metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12953 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The gig::Instrument::UpdateRegionKeyTable function in gig.cpp in libgig4.0.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid memorywrite and application crash) via a crafted gig file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12953` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gigtools - 4.1.0~repack-2
libakai0 - 4.1.0~repack-2
libgig9 - 4.1.0~repack-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libgig package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.0~repack-2').
